p: The risk of viral infections after flood is really important health issue and different classes of infectious diseases can cause outbreaks during the weeks after flooding as shown in Fig. 1. Floods can increase the transmission of viral diseases specially water born infections, such as diarrheal diseases, hepatitis A and E, air-borne infections and vector borne diseases such as yellow fever, west Nile fever (WNF) and dengue fever ( 5, 6). This review explains the viral infections during and after floods.
